snippet: Messages released on Friday offer some of the first evidence of which federal officials had at least some knowledge of the troubles plaguing HealthCare.gov months before its start-up.
abstract: Emails released by congressional investigators show that senior federal officials involved in building HealthCare.gov Web site were deeply concerned about delays as well as weaknesses in quality and size of contractor teams assigned to parts of the project; messages offer some of the first evidence that federal officials had at least some knowledge of troubles plaguing the Web site before its start-up.

byline.contributor: Sharon LaFraniere contributed reporting from New York, and Ian Austen from Ottawa.

lead_paragraph: Messages released on Friday offer some of the first evidence of which federal officials had at least some knowledge of the troubles plaguing HealthCare.gov months before its start-up.

headline.main: Health Site Infighting Detailed in Emails
headline.print_headline: Health Site Infighting Is Detailed In Emails

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
